headline.main: RUSSIANS MENACE NAZI RAIL CENTERS; Take 80 Places Near Zhlobin as Rokossovsky Presses His Drive on Vital Junction

lead_paragraph: LONDON, Friday, Dec. 3 (U.P.) -- Battling in the year's worst fighting weather, Gen. Konstantin K. Rokossovsky's Soviet forces captured more than eighty towns and villages northwest of Gomel yesterday in their drive on Zhlobin, while other Russian troops smashed within six miles of the vital junction of Znamenka, southwest of Kremenchug.
abstract: USSR forces take 80 places near Zhlobin; widen Kremenchug wedge; launch attack along Smolensk-Minsk highway toward Orsha; map
